L2_gloss:
Devanagari script form of 𑀅𑀓𑁆𑀔𑀇
c. 778 CE, Uddyotana, Kuvalayamālā folio 58, lines 2c-3a[1]
अरे, अत्थि चउत्था भासा पेसाया । ता सा इमा होहि त्ति । एत्थ वड-पायववरे पिसायान उल्लावो अक्खइ त्ति ।are, atthi cautthā bhāsā pesāyā. tā sā imā hohi tti. ettha vaḍa-pāyavavare pisāyāna ullāvo akkhaï tti.Here at the great banian tree the Piśācas are conversing. Then again he stood thinking, "What is their conversation?"

Devanagari script form of 𑀅𑀳𑀼𑀡𑀸 (“now”)
1999,  Udayacanda Jaina,  Bāla rūpa Prākr̥ta, page 17:अहुणा तुमं किं पढेसि।ahuṇā tumaṃ kiṃ paḍhesi.What are you studying now?
1967,  Pāiavinnāṇa kahā - Volume 2, page 235:अओ अहुणा इह किं कायव्वं?ao ahuṇā iha kiṃ kāyavvaṃ?What is the work here, now?
1997,  Mrchhakatikam of Sudraka, page 652:अहुणा कुसलिणी संवृत्तम्हि।ahuṇā kusaliṇī saṃvṛttamhi.I'm fine [feminine] now.

c. 861 CE, Ghaṭayāla Inscription line 16:मरुमाडवल्लतमणीपरिअङ्काअज्जगुज्जरत्तासु। जणिओ जेण जणाणं सच्चरिअगुणेहि अणुराओ॥marumāḍavallatamaṇīpariaṅkāajjagujjarattāsu. jaṇio jeṇa jaṇāṇaṃ saccariaguṇehi aṇurāo.By Kakkuka's excellent behaviour and qualities he has won the love of the people in Marumāḍa, Valla, Tamaṇī, . . . . . . and Gujarat.

Devanagari script form of 𑀤𑀼𑀓𑁆𑀔𑀤𑀺 (“to pain; to feel sad”)
1978,  Sivakotyacarya,  Bhagavati aradhana, Jaina-Samskrti-Samrakshaka-Sangha, page 733:णाएण य दाउण को णरो दुक्खदि विलवदि वा॥ṇāeṇa ya dāuṇa ko ṇaro dukkhadi vilavadi vā.By giving justice, who [lit. which man] feels sad or cries?

Devanagari script form of 𑀮𑀳𑀤𑀺 (“to take, gain, acquire”)
1972,  Prakṛta-gadya-padya-bandha - Part 2, Research Institute of Prakrit, Jainalogy, and Ahimsa, page 14:भूदो तावदि कालं लहदि सुहं इंदियं विविहं।bhūdo tāvadi kālaṃ lahadi suhaṃ iṃdiyaṃ vivihaṃ.
1989,  Kundakunda; Śrutasāgarasūri; Jaina, Pannālāla,  Aṣṭapāhuḍa, Bhāratavarṣīya Anekānta Vidvat Pariṣad, page 170:णाणेण लहदि लक्खं तम्हा णाणं च णायव्वं।ṇāṇeṇa lahadi lakkhaṃ tamhā ṇāṇaṃ ca ṇāyavvaṃ.One can fulfil [lit. gain] a lakh desires with knowledge and knowledge in itself is knowable.
2000,  Pancastikaya-Sangraha, Bharatiya Jnanpith, page 64:...लहदि सुहमणिंदियमणंतं।...lahadi suhamaṇiṃdiyamaṇaṃtaṃ.Gets endless, pleasure, which is beyond the reach of indriyas [senses].

Devanagari script form of 𑀲𑀁𑀢𑀡𑀼 (“Shantanu”)
1993,  Svayambhū; Malvania, Dalsukh Bhai; Bhayani, Harivallabh Chunilal,  Svayambhūdeva's Riṭṭhaṇemicariya (harivaṁsapurāṇa), Prakrit Text Society, page 199:संतणु विचित्तवीरिय - अवहि परिपालिय जेण - वि सयल महि सो केम सेव अण्णहो करमि भुव जाम ताम करि वावरमि गुरु - पियर - पियामह खयहो गय...saṃtaṇu vicittavīriya - avahi paripāliya jeṇa - vi sayala mahi so kema seva aṇṇaho karami bhuva jāma tāma kari vāvarami guru - piyara - piyāmaha khayaho gaya...
1996,  Svayambhū; Jaina, Devendra Kumāra,  Riṭṭhaṇemicariu: pt. 1. Jujjha-kaṁd̥a, page 70:भीमहो हय हय संतणु तोए सत्ति विओयरेण परिपेसिय लइय लउडि हरि-पीउसि-सेए।bhīmaho haya haya saṃtaṇu toe satti vioyareṇa paripesiya laïya laüḍi hari-pīusi-see.
1956,  Gaekwad's Oriental Series Issue 118, page 7:निसुणउ हिव इह कन्न वृतंतू एह रहई होइ संतणु कंतू॥nisuṇaü hiva iha kanna vṛtaṃtū eha rahaī hoi saṃtaṇu kaṃtū.
